abstract: American defender Julie Johnston has been key to United States success in Women's World Cup soccer tournament; is busy preparing with team for Round of 16 match against Colombia.
lead_paragraph: Johnston, 23, who supplanted Christie Rampone in the lineup this year, has been an unlikely revelation for the United States in the Women’s World Cup.

headline.main: Julie Johnston, a Late Call-Up for U.S., Continues Her Ascent
headline.print_headline: U.S. Defender Erases Her Own Misgivings, and Rivals’ Chances

snippet: Johnston, 23, who supplanted Christie Rampone in the lineup this year, has been an unlikely revelation for the United States in the Women’s World Cup.
